headline.main: Beijing Journal; A Rotund Shape No Longer Means Good Fortune

docs.lead_paragraph: In this country of skin and bones, Li Yadong is still something of a phenomenon, but the 290-pound, 16-year-old boy is just one of a growing number of children in China who are struggling to shed unwanted extra pounds. "The biggest problem is that I can't find clothes anywhere," Yadong said, adding that his sister makes his clothes.
